meanings.sent1: I will terminate the game when the time is up.
meanings.sent2: The movie will terminate at midnight.
meanings.sent3: Let's terminate this argument and move on to something fun.
meanings.sent4: The journey through the forest will terminate at the magical waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will terminate the lesson with a surprise quiz.

meanings.sent1: The poison will terminate the pests in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The villain planned to terminate the hero's existence.
meanings.sent3: The detective's job is to terminate the criminal's plans.
meanings.sent4: The virus can silently terminate the body's defenses.
meanings.sent5: The hunter aimed to terminate the deer with one shot.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to terminate the employee due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent2: The manager had to terminate the new hire for repeated tardiness.
meanings.sent3: The boss had to terminate the lazy worker to improve productivity.
meanings.sent4: The HR department will terminate the contract of the underperforming staff.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor will terminate the probationary period for the trainee.
